(a) Beginning with which construction worker do diminishing marginal returns set in for Kayla’s Construction Firm? Explain using numbers.

(b) Assume Kayla’s Construction Firm sells its services in a perfectly competitive market at a price of $3. Calculate the marginal revenue product of the fourth construction worker. Show your work.

(c )Kayla’s Construction Firm hires construction workers in a perfectly competitive labor market for construction workers at a wage rate of $110 per hour, and the market price of services remains $3. How many construction workers will Kayla’s Construction Firm hire to maximize its profit? Explain using marginal analysis.

(d) Assume construction workers must pay for a certification exam before they can work in this industry. If the cost of that exam increases, what will happen to each of the following in equilibrium?(i) The market wage rate. Explain.(ii) The number of workers hired in the labor market. Explain.
